required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rivaroxaban (10mg) Given Once Daily in Patients Undergoing Total Hip Replacement Compared to Enoxaparin
clinical_study.official_title: RECORD 1 Study: REgulation of Coagulation in ORthopedic Surgery to Prevent DVT and PE, Controlled, Double-blind, Randomized Study of BAY 59-7939 in the Extended Prevention of VTE in Patients Undergoing Elective Total Hip Replacement

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess if 10 mg BAY 59-7939, taken once daily as a tablet, is safe and prevent blood clot which may form after total hip replacement operation.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Composite endpoint of total VTE i.e.: Any DVT (proximal and/or distal), Non fatal PE, Death of all causes

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the composite endpoint comprising proximal DVT, non-fatal PE and VTE- related death (major VTE)
Incidence of symptomatic VTE during follow-up
The composite endpoint comprising major VTE and treatment-emergent major bleeding
secondary_outcome.time_frame: For major VTE, treatment period: up to Day 36+/-6 ; for major bleeding, from first dose of double-blind study medication to up to two days after last dose of double-blind study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the composite endpoint that results from the primary endpoint by substituting VTE related death for all death
Incidence of the composite endpoint that results from major VTE by substituting all cause mortality for VTE-related death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of double-blind study medication to up to two days after last dose of double-blind study medication

intervention.description: 10 mg OD tablet of rivaroxaban administered for 36 +/- 4 days
Syringe of Enoxaparin active substance at a dose of 40 mg administered for 13 +/- 2 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients aged 18 years or above
- Patients scheduled for elective total hip replacement
Exclusion Criteria:
- Planned, staged total bilateral hip replacement
- Active bleeding or high risk of bleeding contraindicating treatment with low molecular weight heparin
- Contraindication listed in the labeling or conditions precluding patient treatment with enoxaparin
- Conditions prohibiting bilateral venography (e.g. amputation of one leg, allergy to contrast media)
